title: Controllers on AmazonFireTV: RuntimeException
body:
#### Issue details
I have several crashes from Amazon FireTV (AFTT) sticks when players connect a controller.

I have no idea what is causing this problem, however I wanted to add it here because it is not a one-time problem. I have this crash stacktrace once a day in my crash logs so it is perhaps a good idea to add a catch phrase.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Unknown, probably just connecting a game controller to a Fire TV stick. I was not able to reproduce the problem, if I use a controller on my FireTV stick it works well.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
gdx-controllers.

#### Stacktrace
```
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not get input device information.
	at android.hardware.input.InputManager.getInputDevice(InputManager.java:228)
	at android.view.InputDevice.getDevice(InputDevice.java:410)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.controllers.android.AndroidControllers.addController(Unknown Source)
	at com.badlogic.gdx.controllers.android.ControllerLifeCycleListener.onInputDeviceAdded(Unknown Source)
	at android.hardware.input.InputManager$InputDeviceListenerDelegate.handleMessage(InputManager.java:866)
	at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)
	at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135)
	at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5483)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:372)
	at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:984)
	at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:779)
Caused by: android.os.TransactionTooLargeException
	at android.os.BinderProxy.transactNative(Native Method)
	at android.os.BinderProxy.transact(Binder.java:496)
	at android.hardware.input.IInputManager$Stub$Proxy.getInputDevice(IInputManager.java:333)
	at android.hardware.input.InputManager.getInputDevice(InputManager.java:226)
	... 11 more
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [X] Android
